p: Leaves are palmate with 5â€“7 leaflets. The male flower ( Figure 3a) has no petals, usually with five yellowish tepals, and five anthers yielded pollen. The female flower ( Figure 3b) had a single-ovulate and was enriched with the trichome structures, which are the localization of the cannabinoids and the terpenes as shown in Figure 3c. These terpenes are responsible for the defense and interaction with herbivores and pests.
